isis.stitle: TSI 98-08-02 - Command Center with Trip Odometer Option having Symptoms of Display Flicker/Errors, Speedometer/Tachometer Pointers Frozen or Registered Miles Lower Than Actual

subjectgroup.subject: Command Center with Trip Odometer Option having Symptoms of Display Flicker/Errors, Speedometer/Tachometer Pointers Frozen or Registered Miles Lower Than Actual

geninfo.para:
This TSI applies to 9100, 9200, 9300, and 9400 Models with electronic trip odometer option and command center built before date code 0798 (refer to Figure 1
).

Under certain instances, transient voltages (voltage spikes) introduced into the speedometer/tachometer cluster may cause the display to flicker or cause the display to read errors. To prevent the display flicker/error occurrence, a transient voltage filter can be added to the appropriate circuit. The addition of a transient voltage filter may also correct other problems such as frozen speedometer/tachometer needles and registering miles lower than actual miles driven.
This instruction covers modification of the vehicle wiring to add a transient voltage filter in feed circuit 14G to the Command Center to prevent voltage transients from entering the Command Center.

note.para: This modification is not to be installed if the Command Center date code is 0798 or later.

step1.para: Remove fuse/breaker F5-C from the fuse panel.

warning.para: Circuit 14G is at 12 volts even with the key in the off position. If circuit protection is not removed, a short may occur during filter installation which could result in personal injury.

step1.para: Remove four speedometer/tachometer cluster mounting screws and move the cluster away from the mounting surface.

Locate white colored multiple electrical connector on back side of the speedometer/tachometer cluster ( Figure 1
).
Cut circuit 14G approximately three inches from the connector.

Install the filter in circuit 14G paying attention to the labeled leads on the filter. Polarity is critical and the filter labeled leads must be connected as shown in Figure 2
.

Locate ground adaptor connector 455 or 454 which is several inches to the right of the speedometer/tachometer, remove the terminal lock, insert the filter ground lead into an open terminal and re-install the terminal lock.

note.para: The ground adaptor connector has white colored cables.
The right cluster may have to be removed to obtain adequate access.

step1.para: Re-install the speedometer/tachometer cluster and fuse/breaker F5-C.

Compare total miles from the engine ECM with the value displayed on the cluster. If the cluster mileage does not agree with the engine ECM value, use the Pro-Link™ 9000 and IPC cartridge to reprogram the cluster with the mileage value from the engine ECM.

note.para: To program the cluster, the dip switches must be set to "0." After programming the cluster, return the dip switches to their original position.
